intro: Orbea huillensis subsp. huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén orbea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its unique floral display.
